thread.title: Prince Harry meets local school children in Nottingham
thread.title_full: Prince Harry meets local school children in Nottingham

title: Prince Harry meets local school children in Nottingham
text: Share this article Share Harry joined in with Full Effect music and sports sessions at the academy to learn first-hand the difference made by a new drive to mentor secondary school students. During his last visit in October, Harry was mobbed by eager admirers who handed the royal flowers, Nottingham fudge and Haribo jelly sweets. Harry, 32, joins a Full Effect music and sports sessions at Nottingham Academy where he saw first-hand the difference made by a new drive to mentor secondary school students The royal joins a lyrical writing class with local youngsters where he was treated to a rap performance. He last visited Nottingham in October and was mobbed by local admirers Harry looked to be in good spirits as he chatted to local youngsters at Nottingham Academy. Onlookers said the pupils gave Harry tips on rapping following the session Today, he also attended a Coach Core graduation ceremony including many of the teenagers he met on his last visit, and huge crowds gathered outside to catch a glimpse of the royal. Speaking at the event, he praised the scheme for '[inspiring] younger kids within the community, young people who in turn would inspire others through sport.' He also urged youngsters not to 'forget their roots'. The scheme works with 16 to 24-year-olds, developing them into fully fledged sports coaches and, through its professional partnerships, getting them into jobs. Speaking at the Coach Core graduation ceremony, Harry praised the scheme for '[inspiring] younger kids within the community' and urged youngsters not to 'forget their roots' Harry says says farewell to Trevor Rose, manager of the Full Effect project, after his official visit to Full Effect & Coach Core in Nottingham on Wednesday The Trent Bridge Community Trust, Nottingham Rugby Club, the National Ice Centre, Epic Partners, Notts County FC Football in the Community and Nottingham Forest in the Community are among the established sports clubs and charities it works with. Both schemes are supported by The Royal Foundation that work to improve opportunities for young people. Coach Core, in its fifth year, is run by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harryâ€™s Royal Foundation and is on track to be in 10 UK cities by the spring.
